title: Can you only learn by doing? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can accumulate knowledge by reading, shadowing, reading, listening, etc.  This is all fine, but all of this knowledge is not valuable if you can't transfer it into action. I can read ten books about the perfect golf swing. But this would not make me the number one Golf player. Why? Because  whatever we do, there are hundrets of little things involved you only can get good or great at, if you practice.  Evem becoming a better thinker only works if you thing. Which means doing something :)

Learning is done by: 1) thinking (creatively and intuitively) - think with your own unique perspective and curiosity.  2) reading (active reading) - taking your own notes based on what you have read 3) shadowing - observe others and mimic that behavior with precision and accuracy and speed 4) doing after having shadowed someone, congratulation you were trained and if you done it correctly you have understood how to do what you have just learned.
